name: chicagotribune
text:
Today in The Spin:

‚Äì Crestwood mayor indicted in red-light camera bribery scheme

Here are today‚Äôs top stories in Chicago politics: https://t.co/tgRJQqXVn9

name: chicagotribune
text: While Chicago Public Schools pivots to remote learning, Catholic schools in Chicago and its suburbs stand by plans to reopen fully, as teachers and parents fret https://t.co/3B4HSM2ZFt

name: chicagotribune
text:
RT @HeidiStevens13: My favorite story I got to tell this week is about a Stevenson HS teacher's simple, genius invention. A gentle reminder of how hard teachers work to reach and inspire their students, regardless of the obstacles at hand.

üì∏by @StaceyWescott1 

Story here: https://t.co/4ZQntFiFin https://t.co/VQZykFoLzj

name: chicagotribune
text:
RT @EricZorn: Weekend column: Rank speculation about who‚Äôs in the on-deck circle for the U.S. Senate in Illinois. 

https://t.co/encBOnM9yC

name: chicagotribune
text: RT @chitribopinions: National political conventions long ago lost the vital purpose they used to serve. But do you recall how a little-known state senator from Illinois gained a national profile overnight? The moments of meaningful action still matter, Steve Chapman writes. https://t.co/zhHNCaotr0

name: chicagotribune
text: The U.S. Postal Service says it lost $2.2 billion in the three months that ended in June as the beleaguered agency ‚Äî hit hard by the coronavirus pandemic ‚Äî piles up financial losses that officials warn could top $20 billion over two years. https://t.co/6VGdDAb2NL

name: chicagotribune
text: Postmaster General Louis DeJoy is shuffling dozens of officials on his executive leadership team as the U.S. Postal Service announces it lost $2.2 billion in the three months that ended in June https://t.co/o02N4JCYOy

name: chicagotribune
text: President Donald Trump said Friday night he was likely to issue more limited executive orders related to COVID-19, perhaps in the next day or so, if he can‚Äôt reach a broad agreement with Congress https://t.co/c61OxPwTqJ

name: chicagotribune
text: Paramount Theatre in Aurora announced Friday "with a heavy heart" the postponement of its popular Broadway Series for the 2020-21 season https://t.co/J45fAS9IpS

text: Canada‚Äôs last intact ice shelf collapses due to a hot summer and global warming, scientists say https://t.co/DH0aa5leV0

name: chicagotribune
text: Nearly 60 different types of fish can be found in Chicago waterways, a new study shows. Just three decades ago, there were fewer than 10. https://t.co/zWjTgPTKTj

name: chicagotribune
text: Body horror meets historical tragedy and mid-20th Century Black struggle in HBO's imaginative ‚ÄúLovecraft Country,‚Äù shot in part in Chicago and based on the novel of the same name. Here's @phillipstribune's review: https://t.co/KwQAkSsFqr

name: chicagotribune
text: Gov. Pritzker, declaring Illinois is at a ‚Äúmake or break‚Äù moment in fighting the coronavirus pandemic, issued new emergency rules Friday to require businesses and schools to enforce mandatory face mask rules. https://t.co/vNfuQK7pz9

text: Chef Erling Wu-Bower exits Pacific Standard Time in restaurant industry breakup. Chef of Avec takes over. https://t.co/Bpc3g3OuyE

name: chicagotribune
text:
RT @AllyMarotti: We're 7 months into legal weed sales in Illinois, and marijuana sales are up. I dug into the story behind the numbers, and it's pretty interesting. 
Check it out: https://t.co/D0FECMWyj1 @crescolabs  @thccenter @moderncann @brightfieldgrp

name: chicagotribune
text: RT @AllyMarotti: I spent some time today updating this map of where to buy legal weed in Chicago and across Illinois. We're up to 56 dispensaries in the state selling recreational marijuana. That's up from 37 that opened their doors to customers on Jan. 1. https://t.co/xmldxNIMLq
